result.execSummary:
The defendant Lawrence M Howard was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Fine is to be paid at $25 per month commencing 07-01-2016 and the 1st of every month thereafter or serve 8 days jail as penalty for failure to pay.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.addlTxt: with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

David John Behm appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant Lawrence M Howard in court, in custody (OTP'd from New Lisbon Correctional), with attorney Nicole Williams Buttery.   
Jury Trial Cancelled.
Victim notification was complied with.

Defendant enters a plea of No Contest to the charge.
Court finds the defendant Guilty of the charge.


Court orders the following:
Fine:  $379
DV Surcharge:  $100
To be paid at the rate of $25 per month, starting 07/01/16 and the 1st of every month until paid in full.
Alternate:  8 Days in the Waukesha County Jail.


Defendant to be returned to New Lisbon Correctional - FORTHWITH.
filed, to be produced from New Lisbon Correctional Inst.
